companyProfile.companyDescription: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd is an India-based company engaged in providing information technology (IT) services, consulting, and business solutions. Its business segments include Banking, Financial Services and Insurance; Manufacturing; Consumer Business; Communication, Media and Technology; Life Sciences and Healthcare and others, such as Energy, Resources and Utilities, s-Governance, and Products. The Company's products include TCS ADD, TCS BaNCS, TCS BFSI Platforms, TCS CHROMA, TCS Customer Intelligence & Insights, TCS ERP on Cloud, TCS Intelligent Urban Exchange, Quartz-The Smart Ledgers, Jile, TCS Optumera, TCS TwinX, TCS TAP and TCS OmniStore. Its services portfolio consists of Artificial Intelligence, Cloud, Cognitive Business Operations, Consulting, Cybersecurity, Data and Analytics, Enterprise Solutions, Internet of Things (IoT), and Digital Engineering, TCS Interactive, TCS and AWS Cloud, TCS Enterprise Cloud, TCS and Google Cloud, TCS and Microsoft Cloud and others.

recentNews.headline: Zoho sees India as fastest-growing market as enterprise deals accelerate
recentNews.intro: As global markets cool and enterprise spending tightens, bootstrapped Zoho Corp is turning its focus inward, betting big on India?s 63 million-plus small and medium businesses to fuel its next phase of growth.
recentNews.imagecaption: Zoho is India?s biggest privately held tech services provider.

recentNews.headline: What is TCS' new bench policy and why is IT union flagging concerns over ?coercive? rules? All you need to know
recentNews.intro: A complaint has been filed against Tata Consultancy Services over its new bench policy, which mandates 225 billed business days annually.
recentNews.imagecaption: An IT workers' union has raised an alarm over TCS' new bench policy.

recentNews.headline: Lost money to securities fraud? Don't count on a payout from investor protection fund
recentNews.intro: The corpus in India's investor protection fund nearly doubled in a year but direct compensation for investors harmed by securities violations is rare. Here's why
recentNews.imagecaption: Expenditure from IEPF dropped from  ?11.9 crore in FY23 to  ?2.8 crore in FY24, according to the Sebi annual report for 2023-24.

recentNews.headline: Tech Mahindra starts the fiscal with caution and mixed signals
recentNews.intro: Tech Mahindra began FY26 with modest revenue growth and a cautious outlook, as macro uncertainties, especially outside its core US and European markets, weighed on performance.
recentNews.imagecaption: Tech Mahindra?s incremental revenue of $15 million was contributed by its communication business, which is also its biggest vertical, making up a little more than a third of its total revenue.

recentNews.headline: HCLTech starts the year strong, but margins raise worry
recentNews.intro: The positive revenue performance was overshadowed by a sequential decline in net profit and operating margins; the company attributed the margin dip to one-time impacts like specialized hiring and a customer bankruptcy
recentNews.imagecaption: HCL Technologies Ltd, the country?s third-largest information technology services company, reported $3.55 billion revenue for the June quarter, up 1.34% sequentially.

recentNews.headline: TCS expects a rebound after Q1 miss. The Street isn't convinced
recentNews.intro: TCS Q1 result has left investors wondering about whether or not the earnings downgrade cycle for the sector has bottomed out or if there is more pain ahead
recentNews.imagecaption: Despite a disappointing start, the TCS management is confident of achieving better revenue growth in FY26 versus FY25 for international business. (Reuters)

recentNews.headline: TCS salary hike: IT major says wage hikes to 6 lakh employees a ?priority?. Here's what CFO says
recentNews.intro: TCS salary hike: Tata Consultancy Services' CFO said that giving wage hikes to over 6 lakh employees is a ?priority? for the company amid delays in delivering them. Last week, TCS's Chief HR officer said the company has not made any decisions on it so far.
recentNews.imagecaption: TCS salary hike: TCS employee attrition rate jumped 13.8% on a last twelve-month (LTM) basis as of the end of the April to June quarter of FY2025-26.

recentNews.headline: As TCS loses shine, investors place hopes on Infosys, HCLTech
recentNews.intro: TCS is losing investor favour as it trails its closest rivals Infosys and HCLTech in revenue growth and mega deals. The TCS stock now trades at a discount, raising questions about the company's ability to retain an edge in a shifting tech landscape.
recentNews.imagecaption: TCS shares have declined by more than 20% this year. (Aniruddha Chowdhury/Mint)

recentNews.headline: Dividend Stocks: TCS, Bharti Airtel, IDFC Bank, Dabur India, others to trade ex-dividend this week; Check full list
recentNews.intro: Dividend Stocks: Several companies, including Tata Consultancy Services and Bharti Airtel, will trade ex-dividend from July 14 to 18, according to BSE.
recentNews.imagecaption: Dividend stocks: Major companies set to trade ex-dividend next week, including TCS and Bharti Airtel.

recentNews.headline: TCS share price dips 2.5%: Is this a stock to buy after Q1 results 2025?
recentNews.intro: TCS Share Price: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) announced a 6% YoY rise in net profits for the April-June quarter results for the financial year 2025-26. Shares opened lower following the earnings announcement even as brokerages retained buy ratings.
recentNews.imagecaption: TCS Share Price: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares closed 0.06% lower at  ?3,382.30 after Thursday's stock market session, ahead of the Q1 results announcement.
